quest.name: More than a Hunch
journal: Ryne seems troubled by the sight of you.
objectives: Speak with Y'shtola at the Crystarium.
Speak with the manager of suites in the Pendants.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The end to Light's dominion over this world is fast at hand.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: When all of this is over, it would mean a lot to me if we could go and visit Tesleen's grave together. I have such a lot to tell her...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Perhaps their ministrations were not as thorough as I thought. Or perhaps I was a touch too reckless.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text:
Once more shall the night share equal dominion over the firmament.
And yet our travails are far from over...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Is this not the moment Emet-Selch usually chooses to descend upon us? Whatever will we do without his feigned praise and backhanded compliments?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Are you feeling all right, Forename? After you defeated the Lightwarden, I could swear I saw its aether─

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Uh...never mind. I'm still getting used to my powers. It's probably nothing.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm just relieved I was right about where the Warden was hiding.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The last one is hiding in Kholusia, isn't it? I can't feel it from here, believe it or not...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: But perhaps we should head back to the Crystarium first. We have a lot to tell the Exarch...and I think we could all do with some rest.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: She sees it too, then.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Y'shtola said she needed to speak with us. It sounded rather urgent.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The others are with the Exarch. Before we join them, there is something I wish to confirm.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Tell me, Ryne─have you noticed anything peculiar about Forename's appearance of late? Anything at all? Speak freely. SheHe won't mind.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well...since Minfilia bequeathed her power to me, I've been able to see the Light inside herhim...though I didn't think anything of it at first. But after we defeated the Warden in Amh Araeng, I realized something was wrong.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: You've absorbed its aether, Forename. And the Light within you has grown monstrous.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then it is as I suspected.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: How are you feeling?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If naught is done, this will only get worse.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ryne─with the power of the Oracle, you have gained some measure of control over Light, have you not? Is there anything you can do for herhim?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Extinguishing it is out of the question. Even at her strongest, Minfilia could only hold back the Light.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I might be able to suppress it...but I don't know for how long.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then we have no choice but to rely on Urianger and his secrets.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If the next battle is to be the last, you may yet be able to play your part. But you will need all of your strength.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I will discuss strategy with the others and see that everything is made ready for our departure. You are to return to your chambers and rest until then. Understood?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: ...Understood.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm fine. Let me help.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes, Mother...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Good. Whether you want it or not, you have most certainly earned some respite.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This is not the time for false bravado. Should your condition worsen, it could have dire consequences for us all.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now please, return to your chambers and rest.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Hah. None of that cheek, or I will take you across my knee.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now, off with you to the Pendants. We will call for you when the time comes.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Is everything all right, misssir? You don't seem quite yourself.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Perhaps a hot meal and a freshly made bed will improve matters. Your room is ready, if you'd care to retire?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Retire to your quarters?

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Very good. If you should have need of anything─anything at all─pray do not hesitate to call.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: No, this isn't right.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: It would need to be later. After the liberation of Ala Mhigo, perhaps...

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: Please tell me you've finished.

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: We have to go. They'll be upon us any moment.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Very well. Where to next, then?

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: Let's just worry about getting out of the city, and pray the airship is still in one piece.

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: Anywhere we go from here will just be more of the same.

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: Gods. By the sound of that last one, I reckon the knights twelve might be the knights' rubble now.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Is there nothing else we can do?

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: Do? Look around you─this isn't war.

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: It's a sickness, and it's spread to every corner of Eorzea. The city-states are in disarray, and by all accounts the Far East's faring no better.

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: There'll be nothing left of us when this is over.

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: This world is beyond saving...

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: I never tire of that story. When the hero swoops in astride a white dragon to save the little girl...

dialogue.name: BLUECLOTHESMAN
dialogue.text: I could die happy knowing someone like that was still around.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Indeed. But not today. Not while our message remains undelivered.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Have faith, my friend: we will find herhim...

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: What a peculiar dream...

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Was that...the past?
